intro: Yinshania sinuata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed yinshania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, tubular flowers are typically white or pale pink, and they are clustered in inflorescences. Yinshania sinuata is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
